alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 22 at 12:11PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...FLOOD WATCH HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The lower Kankakee River just upstream of the Illinois River. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Localized flooding of low lying areas and property along the river may occur upstream and downstream of the ice jam. Rapid water level fluctuations may occur due to heavy ice cover on the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Will County Emergency Management and ice spotters report an ice jam downstream of Wilmington has begun to shift and break up. If the ice jam were to break up quickly, flash flooding would occur downstream of the jam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood The aerial flood watch has been replaced with a flood advisory.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
